key_risks: Cybersecurity vulnerabilities leading to data breaches
Regulatory and compliance risks due to inefficiencies and mismanagement
Ethical concerns including allegations of forging patient signatures and mismanagement
Dependence on government and insurance contracts creating financial instability
controversies: Recent cyberattack resulting in the theft of patient data
Over $11 million in potential waste identified in NYC emergency contract audit
Controversial $432 million no-bid contract for migrant services
Allegations from Fuzzy Panda report of forging patient signatures and cover-ups in patient care
social_issues: Potential harm to patient trust and satisfaction due to data breaches and ethical concerns
Impact on public health initiatives and reputation due to operational and ethical issues
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and potential legal liabilities
Mismanagement and inefficiencies in government contracts
Ethical allegations impacting corporate governance and reputation

sources.title: Can the comptroller really block the city's DocGo contract? (No.)
sources.snippet: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander brandished a relatively rarely used authority of his office on Wednesday, declining to approve a massive city contract to provide shelter and other services to asylum-seekers. In a letter explaining his rejection, Lander wrote that the $432 million emergency contract to medical services provider DocGo raised a number of fiscal and other concerns.
